head.supplied: 31st July [188]4 ¶ Sir, ¶ ¶ I beg to enclose draft for twelve pounds twelve shillings (£12.12.0) in payment of Mr Charles Walter's account for forming the woods presented by you into books. Will you ...

div.p: MRS 4/3/69-72 Copies of correspondence sent, Archives of Powerhouse Museum, Sydney.

31st July [188]4
editorial addition. The original is a letterpress copy.

I beg to enclose draft for twelve pounds twelve shillings (£12.12.0) in payment of Mr Charles Walter's account for forming the woods presented by you into books. Will you kindly ask Mr Walter to fill in the enclosed voucher form (in duplicate) and return it to me at his early convenience?
See M to J. Maiden, 7 July 1884 (in this edition as 84-07-07a), and J. Maiden to M, 14 July 1884 (in this edition as 84-07-14a).

p.style: font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;

div.p: I have the honour to be,

div.p: The Baron Ferd. von Mueller K.C.M.G. F.R.S.

Samples of Colonial Timbers presented by The Baron Ferd. von Mueller, as under:–
There is another copy of this list at MRS 86, Donation book, 1882-7, pp. 152-4 at the Powerhouse Museum, where the collection is recorded as having been received on 22 July 1884.
